We often design for heat, vibration, EMI, or power surges ‚Äî but what about geomagnetic storms?

A geomagnetic storm is a large-scale disturbance of Earth‚Äôs magnetic field, triggered by solar flares or coronal mass ejections (CMEs). When high-energy charged particles from the Sun hit our magnetosphere, they can induce powerful currents and electromagnetic effects.

üéØ Why this matters to us in tech:

  • üîπ Satellite Systems: GPS, communications, and observation satellites face single-event upsets and orbital drag issues
  • üîπ Power Grids: Geomagnetically induced currents (GICs) can stress transformers and cause major blackouts
  • üîπ Aviation & Navigation: Polar flight routes and GNSS accuracy can be heavily impacted
  • üîπ Pipelines & Subsea Cables: Even underground infrastructure can suffer corrosion and current imbalance

As we move deeper into IoT, space systems, AI navigation, and satellite constellations, space weather resilience becomes mission-critical.
